alert.note: Alert for Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 3:38PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Grand County through 415 PM MDT... At 337 PM MDT, meteorologists and satellite imagery was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Canyonlands National Park, or 23 miles west of Moab, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Grand County, including the following locations... Dead Horse Point State Park. This includes Utah 313 between mile markers 0 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Arches, Grand Flat; Canyonlands, Natural Bridges
